definitions.text: make less strong or intense; soften
examples: The author finally tamed some of his potentially offensive statements

definitions.text: adapt (a wild plant or unclaimed land) to the environment
overcome the wildness of; make docile and tractable
examples: He tames lions for the circus

definitions.text: make fit for cultivation, domestic life, and service to humans
examples: The horse was domesticated a long time ago
The wolf was tamed and evolved into the house dog
she was one of the tamest and most abject creatures imaginable with no will or power to act but as directed

definitions.text: brought from wildness into a domesticated state
